description: Single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing conservatory/addition) incorporating a green roof; installation of canopy over rear south facing sliding glass doors on side west elevation; alterations to rear elevation fenestration involving replacement of one window with brickwork on first floor; removal of window from rear extension side; installation of first floor bay window to rear elevation (following removal of existing first floor balcony); alterations to design of existing rear roof addition involving the increase in height; installation of two additional Conservation rooflights to eastern side elevation's roof slope and one Conservation rooflight to western side elevation's roof slope
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 3209-100 Site Location Plan; 3209-110 Site Location Plan; 3209 CBR-102 Existing Ground, First, Second and Roof Plan Layouts; 3209 CBR-103 Existing Rear Elevations (East, South & West); 3209 CBR-111 Site Plan (Block Plan); 3209 CBR-112 Consented Ground, First, Second and Roof Layouts; 3209 CBR-113 Consented Rear Elevations (East, South & West); 3209 CBR-114 Proposed Ground, First, Second and Roof Plan Layouts; 3209 CBR-115 Proposed Rear Elevations (East, South & West); 3209 CBR-116 Proposed Front and Side Elevations (East, North & West); Design & Access Statement prepared by Volume 3 dated 22 December 2021.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless stated on the application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | No part of the flat roofs of the proposed dwellinghouse shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Existing trees within the area of works as shown on drawing no. 3209CBR-104, shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees. The area beneath the spread of the branches of the trees to be retained and not used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items. Protection of the trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs off site that are adjacent/close to it shall be carried out only in accordance with British Standard 5837:2012 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), and shall be maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.

Reason: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, policies D4, D8 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall be Conservation Grade and lie flat on the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
